nodes.text: Magus was a style of lightsaber hilt that existed during the Imperial Era, and came in both single and double-bladed varieties.

Lightsabers wrought in this style featured emitters with two spike-like protrusions on either side, and elaborate engravings. The hilt then tapered off into a "choke" section which connected to a riged handgrip and pointed pommel.

In 14 BBY the fallen Jedi General Taron Malicos wielded two identical lightsabers fashioned in the Magus style during his time on Dathomir. These sabers were comprised of a mix of bronze and chrome colored alloys, and emmitted scarlet blades.
